agegroup.description: The age group that the respondent belongs to

incomegroup.title: Income Group
incomegroup.description: The annual income of the respondent

born_us.title: Born in US
born_us.description: Whether the respondent was born in the United States.

marital_status.title: Marital Status
marital_status.description: The marital status of the individual

nb_child.title: Number of Children
nb_child.description: Number of children the repsondent has.

education_level.title: Education level
education_level.description: The highest education level achieved by the repsondent.

employment_agg.title: Employment Status
employment_agg.description: The current employment status of the respondent.

social_class.title: Social Class
social_class.description: The social class that the respondent identifies with.

econ_ideology.title: Economic Ideology
econ_ideology.description: The economic ideology that the respondent self-identifies with.

political_party.title: Political Party
political_party.description: The political party that the respondent self-identifies with.

news_media.title: Source of News
news_media.description: The medium from which the respondent gets most of their news

knowledge_econ.title: Knowledge of Economics
knowledge_econ.description: The respondent's self-reported knowedge of economics.

candidate_2016.title: 2016 Presidential Candidate
candidate_2016.description: The candidate whom the respondent supported in the 2016 presidential election.

Personal Exposure.title: Personal Exposure
Personal Exposure.description: Questions on the personal exposure the respondent believes they have to income tax policy

Q03001_en.title: Income Tax Policy Effect
Q03001_en.description: Do you feel that U.S. federal income tax policy has important direct effects on your own life?
sorter: No, It has no direct effects on my own life
It has some effects on my own life
Yes, it has very important direct effects on my own life

Policy Knowledge.title: Policy Knowledge
Policy Knowledge.description: Questions to examine the individual's knowledge of income tax policy

Q04004_en.title: Perceived Equality of Income Tax Share
Q04004_en.description: Do you think that, broadly speaking, everyone in the U.S. currently pays approximately the same share of income in federal personal income taxes or do you think people pay very different shares of income in federal personal income taxes?

Q04005_en.title: Taxed Share by Income
Q04005_en.description: Do you think that people with higher incomes pay a higher or lower share of their total income in federal personal income taxes than people with lower incomes?

Q04007_en.title: Top Tax Rate Threshold
Q04007_en.description: How high is the threshold of total annual income for a married household above which the top tax rate applies?

Q04008_en.title: Proportion in Top Tax Rate
Q04008_en.description: Out of 100 households in the U.S., how many are in the top federal personal income tax bracket?

Q04009_en.title: Top Tax Rate Today
Q04009_en.description: What is the top federal personal income tax rate in the U.S.?

Q04010_en.title: Top Tax Share of Income
Q04010_en.description: What share of their total income do people in the top federal personal income tax bracket pay in taxes?

Q04011_en.title: 1950s Top Tax Rate
Q04011_en.description: Can you guess what the top federal personal income tax rate used to be in the 1950s in the U.S.?

Q04012_en.title: No Federal Income Tax
Q04012_en.description: Out of 100 U.S. households, how many pay no federal income taxes?

Q04013_en.title: Median Tax Share of Income
Q04013_en.description: Imagine a middle class household that is right at the middle of the income distribution, such that half of all households in the U.S. earn more than this household and half earn less. What share of their income do you think such a household pays in federal income taxes?

Q04014_en.title: U.S. Relative Taxation
Q04014_en.description: If you compare the U.S. to other rich countries such as Canada or Western Europe, do you think the U.S. has, on average, higher federal personal income taxes, similar levels of federal personal income taxes, or lower federal personal income taxes than these countries?

Q04016_en.title: Top 1% Share of Income
Q04016_en.description: What share of total national income do you think goes to the top 1% richest households?

Q04019_en.title: Reason for wealth
Q04019_en.description: Which has more to do with why a person is rich?

Q04020_en.title: Change in Top 1% Share of Income
Q04020_en.description: How has the share of total U.S. income that goes to the top 1% in the U.S. evolved over the past 30 years?

Outcomes.title: Outcomes
Outcomes.description: Questions to test the individual's perception of income tax policy outcomes

Q07001_en.title: Tax System Fairness (Broad)
Q07001_en.description: Would you say that the current U.S. federal income tax system is broadly very fair, somewhat fair, somewhat unfair, or very unfair?

Q07002_en.title: Tax System Satisfaction
Q07002_en.description: How satisfied or dissatisfied are you with the current U.S. federal income tax system?

Q07003_en.title: Tax Share Fairness (Specific)
Q07003_en.description: How fair the respondent thinks the tax system is, depending on their treatment
sorter: Pay much less than fair share
Pay much more than fair share

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Would you say that high income, upper-class households in the U.S. today...

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would you say that you...

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Would you say that high income, upper-class women in the U.S. today...

Q07004_en.title: Middle Class Tax Share Fairness
Q07004_en.description:
CONTROL: Would you say that middle-class households in the U.S. today:
“GENDER”: Would you say that women in the middle-class in the U.S. today:

questions.description: Would you say that middle-class households in the U.S. today...

questions.title: Gender
questions.description: Would you say that women in the middle-class in the U.S. today...

Q07005_en.title: Distribution Fairness
Q07005_en.description: Do you feel that the distribution of money and wealth in this country today is fair, or do you feel that the money and wealth in this country should be more evenly distributed among a larger percentage of the people?

Q07006_en.title: Income Inequality Issue
Q07006_en.description: How big of an issue do you think income inequality is in America?

Q07008_en.title: Support Top Income Tax Increase
Q07008_en.description: Would you support raising federal income taxes on higher income households in the following cases?

Keyness Graphs.title: Keyness Graphs
Keyness Graphs.description: Graphs showing relative frequencies of wodrs

Keyness_test.title: Keyness Test
Keyness_test.description: Democratic vs Republican word usage for considerations, goals, and shortcomings

Wordclouds.title: Wordclouds
Wordclouds.description: Graphs showing relative frequencies of wodrs

Wordcloud_test.title: Wordcloud Test
Wordcloud_test.description: Democratic vs Republican word usage for considerations, goals, and shortcomings

Tax Change Behavior.title: Tax Change Behavior
Tax Change Behavior.description:
CONTROL. If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for the rich- est people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage them towards the following behaviors?
YOU. If your federal personal income tax rate were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you towards the following behaviors?
GENDER. If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for a given woman among the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage this woman towards the following behaviors?

Q060001.title: Likeliness to change behavior
Q060001.description: If federal income taxes change, how likely are people to...

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage them to evade taxes

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If your federal personal income tax rate were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for a given woman among the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage this woman to evade taxes

questions.title: Have spouse stop working
questions.description: Have their/your/her spouse stop working

questions.title: Move to state with lower taxes
Be less entrepreneurial
questions.description: Be less entrepreneurial and create fewer businesses

Personal Exposure.title: Personal Exposure
Personal Exposure.description: Questions to examine the individual's exposure to trade policy

Q03001_en.title: Trade policy affects own life
Q03001_en.description: Do you feel that U.S. trade policy has important, direct effects on your own life?
sorter: Yes, it has very important direct effects on my own life; It has some effects on my own life
No, it has no direct effects on my own life

Knowledge about policy.title: Knowledge about policy
Knowledge about policy.description: Questions to examine the individual's knowledge about trade policy

Q04002_en.title: Import tariff
Q04002_en.description: Do you know what an import tariff is?

Q04004_en.title: Import quota
Q04004_en.description: Do you know what an import quota is?

Q04006_en.title: Share of imports that are agricultural
Q04006_en.description: The U.S. imports both industrial (i.e., non-agricultural) and agricultural goods. What share of the goods that the U.S. imports do you think are agricultural goods?

Q04007_en.title: Share of imports subject to tariff
Q04007_en.description: Of all the goods that the U.S. imports, what share do you think is subject to a tariff or import duty?
Q04007_en.source: Office of the US Trade Representative

Q04009_en.title: Principal export destination
Q04009_en.description: To which country does the U.S. export the most, in terms of the net dollar value?

Q04010_en.title: Principal import provenance
Q04010_en.description: From which country does the U.S. import the most, in terms of the net dollar value

Q04011_en.title: Trade evolution over time
Q04011_en.description: Over time, do you think trade between the U.S. and other countries has decreased, stayed more or less the same, or increased?
sorter: It has stayed more or less the same

Expected Effects.title: Expected Effects
Expected Effects.description: Questions to examine the expected effects of trade policy

Q06001_en.title: Effects of Trade
Q06001_en.description: YOU As trade with other countries has increased, to what extent do you think the following firms have lost or gained from it? Please rate on a scale of 1 to 5, 1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot'.

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Large corporations

questions.title: CONTROL

questions.description: Middle-income households

Q06201.title: Effects of Trade
Q06201.description: YOU As trade with other countries has increased, to what extent do you think the following firms have lost or gained from it? Please rate on a scale of 1 to 5, 1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot'.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Large corporations

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Small businesses

Q06201B.title: Personal situation
Q06201B.description: On balance, would you say that trade between the U.S. and other countries has made you better off or worse off?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: On balance, would you say that trade between the U.S. and other countries has made you better off or worse off?

Q06201C_1.title: Magnitude on personal situation
Q06201C_1.description: Please specify the extent to which you think you have lost or won as trade with other countries has increased, on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot').

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Please specify the extent to which you think you have lost or won as trade with other countries has increased, on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot').

Q06003_en.title: Effect on Jobs
Q06003_en.description: Please specify the extent to which you think you have lost or won as trade with other countries has increased, on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot').

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you feel that most American jobs are being affected by US trade policy?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you feel that your own job is being affected by U.S. trade policy?

Q06004_en.title: Effect on Workers
Q06004_en.description: Overall, has international trade helped or hurt U.S. workers?

Q06105.title: Ability to find new job - Low-skilled workers
Q06105.description: CONTROL Do you think it is easy for low-skilled workers to find a job in a different sector from the one they are currently working in?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think it is easy for low-skilled workers to find a job in a different sector from the one they are currently working in?

Q06106.title: Ability to find new job - High-skilled workers
Q06106.description: CONTROL Do you think it is easy for high-skilled workers to find a job in a different sector from the one they are currently working in?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think it is easy for high-skilled workers to find a job in a different sector from the one they are currently working in?

Q06205.title: Ability to find new job
Q06205.description: YOU Would it be easy for you to find a job in a different sector from the one you are currently working in?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would it be easy for you to find a job in a different sector from the one you are currently working in?

Q06007_en.title: Effects on Unemployment
Q06007_en.description: CONTROL Unemployment in some sectors and the decline of some industries in the U.S. ME Unemployment in your sector and the decline of some industries in the U.S.

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Unemployment

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Unemployment

Q06009_en.title: Price of goods
Q06009_en.description: CONTROL Overall, has international trade decreased the prices of goods sold in the U.S.? ME Overall, has international trade decreased the prices of goods that you buy regularly?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Overall, has international trade decreased the prices of goods sold in the U.S.?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Overall, has international trade decreased the prices of goods that you buy regularly?

Q06010_en.title: Innovation
Q06010_en.description: Do you think that the competitive pressure from international trade has increased innovation in the U.S.?

Q06011_en.title: GDP
Q06011_en.description: Overall, do you think that international trade has increased the growth of the GDP in the U.S.?

Q06012_en.title: Dollar value
Q06012_en.description: If the U.S. exports more goods abroad, what do you think will happen to the value of the dollar?

Q06013_en.title: Can trade be beneficial for both sides
Q06013_en.description: When two countries trade with each other, would you say that, in general, both are made better off from the trade or that one gains at the expense of the other one?
sorter: In general, both countries are better off
In general, one country gains, the other one loses

Q06014_en.title: Importing a good produced at a lower price abroad
Q06014_en.description: Imagine the U.S. was better at producing cars than Germany, meaning that it is able to produce better cars at a lower price. Would it still make sense under some circumstances for the U.S. to import cars from Germany?

Example.title: Example
Example.description: Long example about laptops and cars

Q06015.title: Long example
Q06015.description: Long example about laptops and cars

questions.title: Price of cars
questions.description: What will happen to the price of cars in the U.S.?

questions.title: Car consumers
questions.description: Would you say that households who purchase cars in the U.S. are now better off?

questions.title: Low-skilled workers wages
questions.description: What will happen to the wages of low-skilled workers working in the car sector?

questions.title: Price of U.S. laptops abroad
questions.description: Imagine also that the U.S. starts producing and exporting more laptops. What will happen to the price of U.S. laptops abroad, i.e., in the countries where the U.S. sells laptops?

questions.title: High-skilled workers wages
questions.description: What will happen to the wages of high-skilled workers working in the laptop sector?

questions.title: Changing sectors and increase in exports
questions.description: Imagine now that over time, some low-skilled workers from the car sector are able to quit their jobs and find new jobs in the laptop sector. What will happen to their wages now if the U.S. exports more laptops?

questions.title: Export tax on laptops
questions.description: If the U.S. were to impose an export tax on laptops, what would happen to the price of laptops abroad?

questions.title: Import tariff on cars
questions.description: If the U.S. were to impose an import tariff on cars sold in the U.S, what would happen to the price of cars in the U.S?

questions.title: Export increase on wages
questions.description: If exports from your sector to other countries would increase, what do you think will happen to your wage?

questions.title: Import increase on wages
questions.description: If the U.S. started to import more of the goods produced in your sector, what do you think would happen to your wage?

Results.title: Results
Results.description: Questions to examine the results of trade policy

Q07001_en.description: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: 'Increasing trade with other countries and reducing barriers to trade is something the U.S. should aim for.'

Q07002_en.description: How fair would you rate the current U.S. trade policy?

Q07003_en.description: How satisfied or dissatisfied are you with the current U.S. trade policy?

Q07004.description: Do you think some industries should be protected from foreign competition using tariffs or other import restrictions? Select all that apply:

Q07005.description: Do you think particular goods should be protected from foreign competition using tariffs or other import restrictions? Select all that apply.

Q07006_en.title: Effects on Unemployment
Q07006_en.description: CONTROL In your view, what is the best policy tool to help workers in an industry that's declining and threatened by foreign competition? Please rank the following options from best (1) to worst (3). ME In your view, what is the best policy tool to help workers in your industry against the threat of foreign competition? Please rank the following options from best (1) to worst (3).

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Restrict imports

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Restrict imports

questions.title: Provide more generous transfers and direct assistance
CONTROL
questions.description: Provide more generous transfers and direct assistance to these workers, such as retraining programs

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Provide more generous transfers and direct assistance to these workers, such as retraining programs

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Subsidize production in sector

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Subsidize production in sector

Q07007_en.description: What do you think is the best policy tool to ensure national food security?
sorter: Provide more production subsidies in the food sector

Q07008_en.description: If the U.S. starts imposing tariffs on many goods that it imports, how likely or unlikely do you think it is that other countries follow suit and also impose tariffs?

Views on government.title: Views on government
Views on government.description: Questions to examine views on government

Q09003_en.title: Gains and losses of increase in trade
Q09003_en.description: Which statement comes closest to your views about more trade between the US and other countries? When there is more trade between the US and other countries…
sorter: ... most people gain, but a few people lose a lot.'
... most people lose, but a few gain a lot.'

Q02002.title: Main considerations
sorter: ... most people gain, but a few people lose a lot.'
... most people lose, but a few gain a lot.'

Q02003.title: Goals
sorter: ... most people gain, but a few people lose a lot.'
... most people lose, but a few gain a lot.'

Q02004.title: Shortcomings
sorter: ... most people gain, but a few people lose a lot.'
... most people lose, but a few gain a lot.'

Q02005.title: Economic effects if trade barriers increased
sorter: ... most people gain, but a few people lose a lot.'
... most people lose, but a few gain a lot.'

Q02006.title: Who Gains if trade barriers were increased?
sorter: ... most people gain, but a few people lose a lot.'
... most people lose, but a few gain a lot.'

Personal Exposure.title: Personal Exposure
Personal Exposure.description: Questions to examine the individual's exposure to estate tax policy

Q03001_en.title: Federal estate tax affects own life
Q03001_en.description: Do you feel personally affected by the federal estate tax?

Q03004_en.title: Likelihood your estate is taxed
Q03004_en.description: How likely do you think it is that your estate will be subject to the federal estate tax in the future?

Knowledge about policy.title: Knowledge about policy
Knowledge about policy.description: Questions to examine the individual's knowledge about estate tax policy

Q04008_en.title: Small businesses subject to estate tax
Q04008_en.description: Do you think that many or few small business or small farm owners are subject to the federal estate tax?

Q04009_en.title: Double taxation?
Q04009_en.description: Do you think that the federal estate tax is mostly taxing assets that have already been taxed and thus leads to ”double taxation” or do you think that it is mostly taxing assets that have not been taxed before during the life of the owner?
sorter: It mostly taxes assets that have not been taxed before

Q04012_en.title: Cost Basis at Death
Q04012_en.description: Do you know what the stepped-up cost basis at death is?

Q04014_en.title: Example about the federal estate tax
Q04014_en.description: Let’s work through a concrete example about the federal estate tax now. Jack inherits a house from his father. His father paid $50,000 for the house 30 years ago. This house is now worth $350,000 at the time of the father’s death. But Jack manages to sell the house for $400,000.

questions.title: Jack's capital gains
questions.description: What is the amount that the IRS will consider as capital gains that Jack made and that will be taxed at the capital gains tax rate?

questions.title: Jack's father's capital gains
questions.description: What is the amount that the IRS will consider as capital gains that Jack's father made and that will be taxed at the capital gains tax rate?

Q04017_en.title: Top 1% wealth share
Q04017_en.description: How has the share of total U.S. wealth that is held by the top 0.1% evolved over the past 30 years?
sorter: It has increased by a lot
It has decreased by a lot

Q04019_en.title: Reasons for wealth
Q04019_en.description: Which has more to do with why a person is wealthy?
sorter: Because she or he worked harder than others
Because she or he had more advantages than others

Q04010_en.title: Share of estates that are unrealized capital gains
Q04010_en.description: If you think of all the large estates that will be subject to the federal estate tax, what share of those estates would you say is made up of unrealized capital gains that have never been taxed before?

Q04011_en.title: Average rate on taxed estates
Q04011_en.description: Consider the total value of all estates that are passed on and subject to the federal estate tax. In total, what fraction of the total value of these estates is paid in taxes?

Q04006_en.title: Estate tax rate above threshold
Q04006_en.description: At what rate is each dollar of estate that is passed on and falls above the exemption threshold taxed?

Q04007_en.title: Estate tax rate in 1950s
Q04007_en.description: Let’s compare this to how things used to be in the U.S. in the past. At what rate was each dollar of estate that is passed on and falls above the threshold taxed in the 1950s?

Q04003_en.title: Number of estates subject to tax at death
Q04003_en.description: Number of estates subject to tax at death

Q04016_en.title: Share of wealth owned by following groups
Q04016_en.description: What share of all of the wealth in the U.S. do you think is currently owned by the following groups?

questions.title: Share of wealth owned by top 1%
questions.description: What share of all of the wealth in the U.S. do you think is currently owned by the top 1%?

questions.title: Share of wealth owned by bottom 50%
questions.description: What share of all of the wealth in the U.S. do you think is currently owned by the bottom 50%

Q04018_en.title: Share of wealth inherited
Q04018_en.description: What share of total wealth owned by households in the U.S. today is inherited from their parents?

Q04021_en.title: Probability of moving in following ways
Q04021_en.description: What is the probability of moving quintiles in the following ways?

questions.title: Probability to get from bottom to top quintile
questions.description: What is the probability of getting from bottom to top quintile?

questions.title: Probability to get from bottom to third quintile

questions.title: Probability to get from bottom to top quintile
questions.description: What is the probability of getting from bottom to top quintile?

Expected Effects.title: Expected Effects
Expected Effects.description: Questions to examine expected effects of estate tax policy

Q06001_en.title: Increase in federal estate taxes
Q06001_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals towards the following behaviors? “ME” RANDOMIZATION. If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you towards the following behaviors? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women towards the following behaviors?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to evade taxes?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to evade taxes?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to work less?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to work less?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to work less?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to stop working?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to stop working?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to stop working?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to have spouse stop working?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to have spouse stop working?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to have spouse stop working?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to move state?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to move state?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to move state?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to be less entrepreneurial?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to be less entrepreneurial?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to be less entrepreneurial?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to save less?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to save less?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to save less?

Q06002_en.title: Young people - increase in federal estate taxes
Q06002_en.description: CONTROL GROUP AND “ME”. Imagine some people who are currently young and not yet rich, but could possibly expect to get rich and face a higher federal estate tax when they are 25 2. old. If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people towards the following behaviors? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. Imagine women who are currently young and not yet rich, but could possibly expect to get rich and face a higher federal estate tax when they are old. If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these women towards the following behaviors?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Imagine some people who are currently young and not yet rich, but could possibly expect to get rich and face a higher federal estate tax when they are 25 2. old. If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people to evade taxes?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Imagine some people who are currently young and not yet rich, but could possibly expect to get rich and face a higher federal estate tax when they are 25 2. old. If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people to evade taxes?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Imagine women who are currently young and not yet rich, but could possibly expect to get rich and face a higher federal estate tax when they are old. If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these women to evade taxes?

questions.title: CONTROL

Q06004_en.title: Economic Activity
Q06004_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on wealthy households would have on economic activity? “ME” RANDOMIZATION. What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours would have on economic activity? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women would have on economic activity? Hurt economic activity; Have no effect on economic activity; Help economic activity
sorter: Have no effect on economic activity

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on wealthy households would have on economic activity?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours would have on economic activity?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women would have on economic activity?

Q06005_en.title: Federal Budget Deficit
Q06005_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. Which comes closer to your view about the long-term impact that cuts in the federal estate tax for wealthy households may have on the federal budget deficit: “ME” RANDOMIZATION. Which comes closer to your view about the long-term impact that cuts in the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours may have on the federal budget deficit: “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. Which comes closer to your view about the long-term im- pact that cuts in the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women may have to pay may have on the federal budget deficit:
sorter: The tax cuts would increase the deficit in the long run because the government would take in a lot less money that it won’t be able to recover
The tax cuts would decrease the deficit in the long run because they would stimulate the economy and bring in more money for the government

Q06006_en.title: Federal Budget Deficit
Q06006_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality? “ME” RANDOMIZATION. Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality?
sorter: It is one of the best ways to reduce wealth inequality
It is a good way to reduce wealth inequality, but there are better ways
It is a bad way to reduce wealth inequality
It is one of the worst ways to reduce wealth inequality

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality?

Q06008_en.title: Fairness of wealthy parents paying estate tax at death
Q06008_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate of wealthy parents who have worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to their children is subject to the federal estate tax at death? “ME” RANDOMIZATION. Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate for which you have worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to your children will be subject to the federal estate tax at your death? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate of a wealthy woman who has worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to her children is subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate of wealthy parents who have worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to their children is subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate for which you have worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to your children will be subject to the federal estate tax at your death?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate of a wealthy woman who has worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to her children is subject to the federal estate tax at death?

Q06009_en.title: Fairness of wealthy estate tax at death
Q06009_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. Imagine now wealthy parents who are wealthy because they have them- selves inherited a lot of wealth from their own parents. Would you say that it is fair or unfair for their estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death? “ME” RANDOMIZATION. Imagine now parents wealthier than you, who are wealthier than you because they have themselves inherited a lot more wealth from their own parents than you. Would you say that it is fair or unfair for their estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. Imagine now a woman who is wealthy because she has herself inherited a lot of wealth from her parents. Would you say that it is fair or unfair for her estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Imagine now wealthy parents who are wealthy because they have them- selves inherited a lot of wealth from their own parents. Would you say that it is fair or unfair for their estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Imagine now parents wealthier than you, who are wealthier than you because they have themselves inherited a lot more wealth from their own parents than you. Would you say that it is fair or unfair for their estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Imagine now a woman who is wealthy because she has herself inherited a lot of wealth from her parents. Would you say that it is fair or unfair for her estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

Q06010_en.title: Fairness of wealthy family resources
Q06010_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. Do you think it is fair or unfair that children born in very wealthy families have access to better schools, better medical care, better neighborhoods, and better professional and social networks than children from less wealthy families? “ME” RANDOMIZATION. Do you think that it is fair or unfair that people born in wealthier families than yours have had access to better schools, better medical care, better neighbor- hoods, and better professional and social networks than you have had? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. Do you think that it is fair or unfair that a girl born to a very wealthy mother has access to better schools, better medical care, better neighborhoods, and better professional and social networks than a girl born to a less wealthy mother?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think it is fair or unfair that children born in very wealthy families have access to better schools, better medical care, better neighborhoods, and better professional and social networks than children from less wealthy families?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you think that it is fair or unfair that people born in wealthier families than yours have had access to better schools, better medical care, better neighbor- hoods, and better professional and social networks than you have had?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Do you think that it is fair or unfair that a girl born to a very wealthy mother has access to better schools, better medical care, better neighborhoods, and better professional and social networks than a girl born to a less wealthy mother?

Q06011_en.title: Fairness of wealthy family inheritance
Q06011_en.description: CONTROL GROUP. Do you think it is fair or unfair that children born in very wealthy families inherit much more than children born in less wealthy families? “ME” RANDOMIZATION. Do you think it is fair or unfair that people born in wealthier families than yours inherit more than you? “WOMEN” RANDOMIZATION. Do you think that it is fair or unfair that a girl born to a very wealthy mother inherits much more than a girl born to a less wealthy mother?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think it is fair or unfair that children born in very wealthy families inherit much more than children born in less wealthy families?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you think it is fair or unfair that people born in wealthier families than yours inherit more than you?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Do you think that it is fair or unfair that a girl born to a very wealthy mother inherits much more than a girl born to a less wealthy mother?

Q07001_en.title: Fairness of wealth and money distribution
Q07001_en.description: Do you feel that the distribution of money and wealth in this country today is fair, or do you feel that the money and wealth in this country should be more evenly distributed among a larger percentage of the people?
sorter: The distribution of money and wealth in this country today is fair
The money and wealth in this country should be more evenly distributed among a larger percentage of the people

Do you or someone in your household pay the total costs, does an employer or other organization pay the total cost, or is it the cost shared between the employer or some other organization and you or someone in your household?

TO DO.title: Who pays for long-term care

correct: Private long-term care insurance plans will pay for long-term care for all elderly who purchased them
Medicaid will pay for all of long-term care only for the elderly who have a low income and low assets

sorter: A penalty had to be paid
You were forced to buy insurance

Q04013_en.description: Were any changes made to the individual mandate in 2019?

sorter: The penalty was reduced to zero

Q04015_en.title: Is there an employer mandate

sorter: Yes, all employers are required to provide health insurance to their employees
Yes, but small employers are excluded from this requirement
No, employers are not required to provide health insurance to their employees

Q04016_c_en.title: % of FPL for Medicaid eligibility
Q04016_c_en.description: To be eligible for Medicaid, a family's income needs to be below a certain percentage of the Federal Poverty Level for a family of that size. How high is that percentage in your state fo a family like yours to be eligible for Medicaid?

Q06002.description: Would you say that an individual mandate is beneficial or detrimental? Please explain your reasoning.

Q06003_en.title: Fear of changing job because of health insurance
Q06003_en.description: CONTROL If people have health insurance through their employer, do you think this would discourage them from quitting a bad job or switching job from fear of losing their health insurance? ME If you have or had health insurance through your employer, do you think this would discourage you from quitting a bad job and switching job for fear of losing your health insurance? WOMEN If women have health insurance through their employer, do you think this would discourage them from quitting a bad job or switching job from fear of losing their health insurance?

questions.title: GENDER

ME If your health insurance were to be made more generous, to what extent would it encourage you towards the following behaviors? WOMEN If health insurance were to be made more generous, to what extent would it encourage women towards the following behaviors?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Make less use of the emergency room for conditions that do not warrant it

questions.title: GENDER

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Use more medical services they do not really need simply because they do not have to pay the full cost of them

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Use more preventive medical care such as regular screenings and check-ups

Q06006_en.title: Would less generous coverage worsen medical care
Q06006_en.description: CONTROL With less generous health insurance, health in the U.S. would be worse since many people could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care. ME With less generous health insurance, my health would be worse since I could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care. WOMEN With less generous health insurance for women's health issues, health in the U.S. would be worse since many women could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care.

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: With less generous health insurance, health in the U.S. would be worse since many people could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: With less generous health insurance, my health would be worse since I could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: With less generous health insurance for women's health issues, health in the U.S. would be worse since many women could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care.

Q06007_en.title: Would more generous coverage reduce total costs
Q06007_en.description: CONTROL More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care can lead to a reduction in total medical costs, since medical issues would be caught early on before they turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether. ME More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care can lead to a reduction of my total medical costs, since it would allow me to catch medical issues early on before they turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether. WOMEN More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care for women can lead to a reduction in total medical costs, since women's medical issues would be caught early on before they turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether.

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care can lead to a reduction in total medical costs, since medical issues would be caught early on before they  turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care can lead to a reduction of my total medical costs, since it would allow me to catch medical issues early on before they turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care for women can lead to a reduction in total medical costs, since women's medical issues would be caught early on before they turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether.

Q06008_en.title: Would more generous coverage reduce financial stress
Q06008_en.description: CONTROL More generous health insurance can help people deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce financial stress and debt built up to pay the medical bills for families. ME More generous health insurance could help me deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce my financial stress and I won't have to build up debt to pay the medical bills for my family. WOMEN More generous health insurance can help women deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce women's financial stress and debt built up to pay the medical bills for women's health issues.

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: More generous health insurance can help people deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce financial stress and debt built up to pay the medical bills for families.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: More generous health insurance could help me deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce my financial stress and I won't have to build up debt to pay the medical bills for my family.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: More generous health insurance can help women deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce women's financial stress and debt built up to pay the medical bills for women's health issues.

Q06009_en.title: Is it fair that pre-existing conditions pay more
Q06009_en.description: CONTROL Would you say that it is fair or unfair that people with pre-existing conditions have to pay more for their health insurance than people without pre-existing conditions? ME Would you say that it is fair or unfair if you had to pay more for your health insurance than people with fewer pre-existing conditions than you? WOMEN Would you say that it is fair or unfair that women with pre-existing conditions have to pay more for their health insurance than women without pre-existing conditions?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that people with pre-existing conditions have to pay more for their health insurance than people without pre-existing conditions?

Q06010_en.description: CONTROL Is it fair or unfair that people born with worse health have to pay more for health care or insurance than people born with better health? ME Is it fair or unfair if you had to pay more for health care or insurance than people born with better health than you? WOMEN Is it fair or unfair that women born with worse health have to pay more for health care or insurance than women born with better health?

Q06111.title: Main responsibility in health issues
Q06111.description: CONTROL Would you say that health issues and medical conditions are mostly the result of circumstances outside of one's control or mostly the result of one's own actions? ME Would you say that your own health issues and your own medical conditions are mostly the result of circumstances outside of your control or mostly the result of your own actions? WOMEN Would you say that health issues and medical conditions that arise for women are mostly the result of circumstances outside of their control or mostly the result of these women's own actions?

questions.title: CONTROL Main responsibility in health issues
sorter: Mostly the result of circumstances outside of one’s control
Mostly the result of one’s own actions

questions.description: Would you say that health issues and medical conditions are mostly the result of circumstances outside of one's control or mostly the result of one's own actions?

sorter: Mostly the result of circumstances outside of one’s control
Mostly the result of one’s own actions

questions.description: Would you say that your own health issues and your own medical conditions are mostly the result of circumstances outside of your control or mostly the result of your own actions?

Mostly the result of one’s own actions

Q06013_en.title: Everyone affords health care to reduce contagion
Q06013_en.description: CONTROL It is important that everyone can afford health care because people who become sick with a contagious disease that is not treated can have negative effects on others too. ME It is important that I am able to afford health care because if I became sick with a contagious disease that is not treated, I can have negative effects on others too. WOMEN It is important that all women can afford proper health care because women who become sick with a contagious disease that is not treated can have negative effects on others too.

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: It is important that everyone can afford health care because people who become sick with a contagious disease that is not treated can have negative effects on others too.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: It is important that I am able to afford health care because if I became sick with a contagious disease that is not treated, I can have negative effects on others too.

Q06014_en.description: CONTROL It is important to help low-income families so that they can afford medical care by subsidizing their insurance premiums or by giving them transfers for medical care. ME It is important to help families like mine so that they can afford medical care by subsidizing our insurance premiums or by giving us transfers for medical care. WOMEN It is important to help low-income women so that they can afford medical care by subsidizing their insurance premiums or by giving them transfers for medical care.

Q06015_en.title: Employers with religious objections
Q06015_en.description: If you had to choose, which comes closest to your view? Employers who have religious objections to the use of birth control should be...
sorter: ... able to refuse to provide it in health insurance plans for their employees.
... required to provide it in health insurance plans for their employees just as other employers are required to do.

Results.title: Results
Results.description: Questions to examine the results health policy

Q07001_en.title: Fairness in access to healthcare
Q07001_en.description: Do you feel that access to health care in the U.S. today is fair for everyone, even for low-income families, or do you feel that access to healthcare should be improved for many families?
sorter: Access to health care is fair even for low-income families
Access to health care should be improved for many families

Q07004_en.title: Fairness of US health insurance system
Q07004_en.description: How fair would you say the current U.S. health insurance system is?

Q07005_en.title: Satisfaction with US health insurance system
Q07005_en.description: How satisfied or dissatisfied are you with health insurance in the U.S.?

Q07006_en.title: Support for Medicare-for-all
Q07006_en.description: As you may know, some have proposed a 'Medicare-for-all' single payer health insurance program that would be administered by the federal government advanced through taxes. Please tell us if you favor or oppose this proposal, or if you don't know enough to say?

Q07007_en.title: Support for additional help for low income families
Q07007_en.description: Do you support or oppose providing additional transfers or subsidies to low-income families to help them with the costs of their health care?

Q07008_en.title: Support for individual mandate
Q07008_en.description: Do you support or oppose having an individual mandate whereby every individual is obliged to buy health insurance?

Q07010_en.title: Support for employer mandate
Q07010_en.description: Do you support or oppose having an employer mandate whereby every large employer, with more than 50 employees, is obliged to offer health insurance plans for their employees?

Q07010_1_en.title: Desired design of health insurance
Q07010_1_en.description: Imagine it were up to you to design Americans' health insurance plans such that they are most cost-effective and that patients get the best care while having to pay the lowest insurance premiums. For the following types of medical care, please say which ones should receive: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)" "generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)" "low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)" "no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket). Bear in mind that the more generous coverage is, the higher health insurance premiums can be expected to be.

questions.title: Preventive care
questions.description: Preventive care (e.g.: annual physical examinations, recommended cancer screening, or immunizations)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Primary care visits
questions.description: Primary care visits for non-life threatening conditions (e.g.: for a cold, flu, or stomach bug)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Maternity and newborn care
questions.description: Maternity and newborn care (pre-natal screenings and check-ups, birth and delivery, newborn screening and care)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Specialist visits for non-essential care
questions.description: Specialist visits for non-essential care (e.g.: elective hip replacement, hearing aids)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Medical care for catastrophic situations
questions.description: Medical care for catastrophic situations (e.g.: long-run medical care after bad accidents or serious injuries once one leaves the emergency room, intensive treatment for cancers, management of serious, long-term hear and liver conditions)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Emergency room care
questions.description: Emergency room care (emergency, short-term care after accidents, severe illness, life-threatening conditions that require immediate attention)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Pediatric care
questions.description: Pediatric care (medical care for children)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)
